00001 /**
00002  * \file RandomLambda.cpp
00003  * \brief Using the STL and lambda expressions with %RandomLib
00004  *
00005  * Compile/link with, e.g.,\n
00006  * g++ -I../include -O2 -funroll-loops
00007  *   -o RandomLambda RandomLambda.cpp ../src/Random.cpp\n
00008  * ./RandomLambda
00009  *
00010  * $Id: 356a56215a121fee2ca1bfcc337c3c7f0e5068bb $
00011  *
00012  * See \ref stl, for more information.
00013  *
00014  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2006-2011) <charles@karney.com> and licensed
00015  * under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00016  * http://randomlib.sourceforge.net/
00017  **********************************************************************/
00018 
00019 #include <iostream>
00020 #include <vector>
00021 #include <RandomLib/Random.hpp>
00022 #include <RandomLib/NormalDistribution.hpp>
00023 
00024 #if (defined(__GXX_EXPERIMENTAL_CXX0X__) && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 5) || \
00025     (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >= 1600)
00026 #  define HAVE_LAMBDA 1
00027 #else
00028 #  define HAVE_LAMBDA 0
00029 #endif
00030 
00031 /// \cond SKIP
00032 #if !HAVE_LAMBDA
00033 // Don't need to define these if we can use lambda expressions
00034 template<typename RealType = double> class RandomNormal {
00035 private:
00036   RandomLib::Random& _r;
00037   const RandomLib::NormalDistribution<RealType> _n;
00038   const RealType _mean, _sigma;
00039 public:
00040   RandomNormal(RandomLib::Random& r,
00041                RealType mean = RealType(0), RealType sigma = RealType(1))
00042     : _r(r), _n(RandomLib::NormalDistribution<RealType>())
00043     , _mean(mean), _sigma(sigma) {}
00044   RealType operator()() { return _n(_r, _mean, _sigma); }
00045 };
00046 
00047 template<typename IntType = unsigned> class RandomInt {
00048 private:
00049   RandomLib::Random& _r;
00050 public:
00051   RandomInt(RandomLib::Random& r)
00052     : _r(r) {}
00053   IntType operator()(IntType x) { return _r.Integer<IntType>(x); }
00054 };
00055 #endif
00056 /// \endcond
00057 
00058 int main(int, char**) {
00059   RandomLib::Random r; r.Reseed();
00060 #if HAVE_LAMBDA
00061   std::cout << "Illustrate calling STL routines with lambda expressions\n";
00062 #else
00063   std::cout << "Illustrate calling STL routines without lambda expressions\n";
00064 #endif
00065   std::cout << "Using " << r.Name() << "\n"
00066             << "with seed " << r.SeedString() << "\n\n";
00067 
00068   std::vector<unsigned> c(10);  // Fill with unsigned in [0, 2^32)
00069 #if HAVE_LAMBDA
00070   std::generate(c.begin(), c.end(),
00071                 [&r]() throw() -> unsigned { return r(); });
00072 #else
00073   std::generate<std::vector<unsigned>::iterator, RandomLib::Random&>
00074     (c.begin(), c.end(), r);
00075 #endif
00076 
00077   std::vector<double> b(10);    // Fill with normal deviates
00078 #if HAVE_LAMBDA
00079   RandomLib::NormalDistribution<> nf;
00080   std::generate(b.begin(), b.end(),
00081                 [&r, &nf]() throw() -> double
00082                 { return nf(r,0.0,2.0); });
00083 #else
00084   std::generate(b.begin(), b.end(), RandomNormal<>(r,0.0,2.0));
00085 #endif
00086 
00087   std::vector<int> a(20);  // How to shuffle large vectors
00088 #if HAVE_LAMBDA
00089   int i = 0;
00090   std::generate(a.begin(), a.end(),
00091                 [&i]() throw() -> int { return i++; });
00092   std::random_shuffle(a.begin(), a.end(),
00093                       [&r](unsigned long long n) throw() -> unsigned long long
00094                       { return r.Integer<unsigned long long>(n); });
00095 #else
00096   for (size_t i = 0; i < a.size(); ++i) a[i] = int(i);
00097   RandomInt<unsigned long long> shuffler(r);
00098   std::random_shuffle(a.begin(), a.end(), shuffler);
00099 #endif
00100 
00101   return 0;
00102 }
